comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See for a similar picture, also with Sue Spiller, although I would not be certain about the two pictures having a woman in common. But it does seem likely that these women are telling fortunes to raise money for war relief. And since the next picture is on Governor's Island, this could also be there. The War Relief garden party on Governor's Island would appear to be an event that took place annually for several years, at least: 1914, see NYT of 5/27/1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9500E2DC1F39E633A... 1915, see NYT of 5/27/1915 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F05E7D91338E633A... 1917, see NYT of 6/7/1917 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F03E7DE133AE433A... This last piece mentions both Miss Sue Spiller (as Princess Ismah) and Mrs. T. Q.[sic] Donaldson.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Mrs. T.Q. Donaldson is almost certainly the wife of Major General Thomas Quinton Donaldson, who was stationed at Governors Island as Assistant Inspector General during the first three years of WWI. www.arlingtoncemetery.net/tqdonaldson.htm His widow was Mrs. Elizabeth Wilson Donaldson.

comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content: Is this picture flipped?  The stars should be on the left not the right.
